headline: Barbie's Tuna Salad
description: The best tuna salad recipes tend to have a secret ingredient. This recipe has two! Curry powder and Parmesan cheese add a terrific boost of flavor.

video.description: Spice up tuna salad with a little curry and Parmesan.
video.name: Barbie's Tuna Salad

name: Barbie's Tuna Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 (7 ounce) can white tuna, drained and flaked

recipeInstructions.text: Combine tuna, mayonnaise, relish, Parmesan cheese, and onion flakes in a medium bowl.
Season with parsley, dill, curry powder, and garlic powder. Mix well and serve with crackers or on a sandwich.

review.reviewBody: it was great just like it called for . I tried it on toasted whole wheat bread with a little dejon on one side with a leaf of romane . I will definatly be doing this one again.

Barbie, thank you for sharing your delicious recipe. There is a chef in the Cinque Terre region of Italy that makes this recipe using white fish. She is paid a lot of money to create her fish dish using the subtle ingredient... curry powder. It is served in empty orange halves.

Substitutions I made because it is what I have on hand. Low Fat (1%) Cottage Cheese that I put in my mini chopper until smooth, for the Greek yogurt and mayo. This saved on fat and calories. Dill relish for sweet relish For a less saucy salad I used two 5oz cans water packed tuna. We used hot dog buns. Because I haven't been to the grocery store. My husband was skeptical, but his response after his first bite....Mmmmm that is good! This is a keeper. I have been using this recipe since 2018. It is my go to for both Tuna and Chicken salad. I add more onion and dill, the amount varies to our taste on that day. Make changes to meet your family's taste. We also use tortilla,casava root chips or celery in place of bread or buns.
Add onions and horseradish will kick it up even more
Super delicious, but I add fresh onion and significantly more parmesan and dried/fried onions. We eat it with crackers and on sandwiches.
Loved it! Kept all the seasonings the same. My healthier changes: 1 T lite mayo 1 cup diced apples for crunch and fiber. Served on Ole Extreme Wellness tortillas. Only 50 cal each.
Loved it but will def use less mayo next time and maybe less relish! BF and kids loved it as well. Thanks for such a delish recipe!!
Very good! I added finely chopped celery, more onion and less mayo. Did not have curry. After tasting it, it needed a little bit of salt and pepper. Loved it!
This my family's favorite sandwich!

I am just not a fan of tuna. I keep trying it but never can get on the bandwagon...until THIS recipe. It was absolutely delicious!!! Even my 4 year old twins, who also are not fans of tuna, ate it happily and then declared we should make it for Thanksgiving lol (we won't be but I appreciate the sentiment).
Amazing! A must try, the only way i will eat tuna salad
Excellent. This is now my new tuna salad recipe!
Great! I've made this recipe a few times and it's my go to now for tuna salad.

I was disappointed. Too mayonnaise-y (and I love mayonnaise) and not enough onion. I even added a couple of TBS of my own fresh diced onion, but still not enough. I also didn't like the sweet relish. I like more of a dill flavor to my tuna salad, so I will keep looking for a recipe to add to my rotation.
I found it had great flavor and was excellent as a tuna sandwich and cracker topping.
Really great flavors with definitely be making again!
I make this recipe without the sweet pickles for a more savory tuna salad. I think the dill and curry work perfectly !

I love tuna salad...always on the lookout for something a little different. That said, I LOVE THIS RECIPE! I love the fact that this can be made just from items people normally have in their spice cabinets--no need to run to store. The dill, curry and parmesan create a unique flavor combination that I think is fantastic. Curry...who'd a thought?
Not a big tuna salad fan but I did really like this. Not real fishy tasting. I doubled the tuna but not everything else - Gave it a taste then added ingredients I thought needed some more.
It was definitely the best Tuna salad I’ve had. I cut the Mayo in half.
I used the sweet spicy dill pickles on this site also.and a five ounce can of tuna, very ,very good.
So so good. I put in fresh parsley, dill and onion tho. This recipe made me love tuna salad!

Hands down 5 stars! I have eaten a lot of tuna salad and this is absolutely the best I've ever had. The curry surprisingly makes it so amazing. I'm not a huge fan of relish so I finely chopped the same amount of celery and added it instead and it is divine!
Love this recipe!

looking for a different tuna salad and this was very good - only change was to substitute chopped fresh dill instead of relish - a very different taste - and also tried chopped feta instead of parm - worth a try by others
good
Good recipe for tuna. However, it needs at least for a sandwich something fresh like spinach, lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers.
I'm not a big tuna sandwich fan but this is probably the best tuna sandwich I have ever tasted!
My only change was to add a stalk of celery. Hubby said it was a keeper. It went over so well, I was asked to make it twice in one week.
Best recipe around…of course I added more Parmesan

Perfect marriage of tang and depth in this tuna salad...things I never thought I’d say! This is really a hit, the relish and Mayo work well against the volume of dry spices and the curry makes it even better. Best if you let it rest in the fridge half the day and then break it out for luncheon or dinner.
Tasted great! definitely a good tuna salad recipe! Made enough for 2 loaded sandwichesm
Sorry guys...for the first time ever, I don't agree. This is the first recipe I have found truly inedible. Cannot understand all the rave reviews.
Skip the curry

This was really good. I doubled the recipe as written plus added an additional can of tuna for a total of 3 (for the texture I prefer). Excellent and different flavor from our usual tuna salad. Rave reviews from the family.

Used chopped onion and celery. Only used 3 TBSP pickle relish and drained juice before adding to Mayo Also mixed all seasoning and relish and cheese into Mayo before adding to the tuna. Chilled for a couple of hours
This is the only way I make my tuna salad now. So flavorful!
Wow this is good! I’ll probably make this all the time now.
I absolutely love this recipe. I use two 12oz cans of tuna in water, drained (really well), and add all the other ingredients. Great dip for Low-Fat Wheat Thins, and Triscuits.
Made for 12 servings. Very soupy. Had to add 2 cans of tuna

My absolute favorite tuna salad recipe!
My hubby and I add chopped boiled eggs!
Tried this Tuna Salad and it was ok. I really didn't like the curry addition and would taste better without.

I love tuna so much! I eat it all the time and this is by far one of the best versions I have ever had! I have never used a recipe I just make it with what I have but I was bored and thought I should look, soooooo good!
This tuna salad is amazing! The curry powder is definitely what makes this so delicious.
This is amazing! I think folks reducing the Mayo aren’t taking into account that the tuna cans are now only 5 oz. I used a can and a half and it’s perfect!
I used half the Mayo and no dill (I didn’t have it and don’t love it anyway) and it’s still delicious and easy. I’ve made this several times and it’s a keeper.

Made it ... put al ingredients together and used my electric mixer to blend - it came out really good. With the consistency of that my husband thought it was almost a smoke fish dip! Going to read other reviews and may try tweaking the recipe to try some differences. I’m thinking next time add jarred, diced jalapeño... hmmm.
I printed the recipe and put it in my favorite recipe book. This was a surprise way of making a tuna salad that will be my go to recipe. I wish I could rate it higher.

Amazing! I made this exactly as written and I'm not getting how others claim it's soupy. do you not drain the liquid put off the can first? others who change the recipe then come and give it a bad review at in a class by themselves. it's not the recipe that is bad, it's the changes you made, to your personal preferences. this has been my go to the recipe for the last few years. don't change a thing.
Ooo, I just tried this a couple of days ago and I did not like it!! Was really looking forward to a great tuna salad sandwich but it wasn't! So disappointed!
I made it just like the recipe said. It turned out great!

Didn't change a thing. Yum! Thank you! 
 It's chilling in the frig and going on fresh baked croissants for dinner.
Probably would have been better if I had a full measure of sweet pickle relish. I am certainly not going to throw it out, as it was good.
Definitely too much mayonnaise - and I like mayonnaise. I didn't feel as though there was anything special about this. I won't make again.

This is the best tuna salad I have ever made. So much better after the first day. I used Kewpie Mayo, threw in a hard boiled egg and a handful of Craisins to add sweetness. The flavors of the curry, dill and relish are addictive. Keeping this one.
This recipe is the best! I make it all the time, and the curry is just, chef's kiss. Only things I add is diced cucumber and diced tomato, but its amazing regardless! Definitely recommend!!!

Absolutely delicious! I almost passed this recipe by when I saw curry powder as one of the ingredients but after reading so many reviews I decided to try it. I made about a 1/4 of this recipe to make sure it really was as good as the reviews said. The curry powder gave it a Smokey flavor and all the other ingredients just meshed to give it such a unique & wonderful taste! 
I decided this was the recipe to make for my daughter in law’s baby shower.....It was a hit! 
Thanks for a great keeper!
Great and easy! Be sure to match the dry ounces of tuna package to recipe and drain well. Had no currey aso I added celery salt. I also used dill
This is by far the Best tuna salad ever! It’s my go to from now on!

Even though I mistakenly used thyme in place of dill, I added the dill and it’s still great. Next time, no thyme ??. I had to increase other spices because of my error, but it is still great. Not your momma’s tuna salad!
FANTASTIC!
Wonderful!!
I haven’t made any tuna salad BUT this one is SO good that I don’t ever need a different recipe! It is amazing!
Amazing I added a heaping tablespoon of inglehoffer cream style horseradish instead of curry and only had fresh parsley.... 100% making it again
I loved it! I might back off on the mayo just a bit next time but made as rotten is excellent.
I added some diced celery and carrot, and didn't use as much mayo.

I’ve always used chopped dill pickle in my tuna salad so I thought I’d try it with sweet relish. Also I would never smother my tuna in that much mayo. The parm was unnecessary too and I like fresh ingredients. Glad many of you love it.
I love this recipe but I made a few tweaks. I added 1/2 stalk celery, reduced mayo by half, and added a small dash of pesto with some horseradish also. Perfection, try it you'll love it.
Literally perfect as written.
everyone loved this tuna salad. my wife made sure we would be able to find the recipe later. great tuna.
Very good
I’ve used this recipe in the past with tuna and today used the same recipe with canned chicken (two 5 oz cans of chicken). It is excellent either way and always a hit!

Hands down the best tuna salad I've ever tasted. I add a little more spices than on recipe. The way I see it more is always better. Anything that calls for 1/2 gets full and anything that asks for 1/8 or pinch gets half.
It's tasty and the curry adds kind of a warmth to this salad. I did add about 1-1.5 Tbs of lemon juice to add a freshness, but not necessary - still good without.

Well i initially wanted a different tuna salad, and I saw this one, and it looked so weird, I mean who puts curry in tuna salad? But wow, this is wonderful and tasty and so different. But i would not feed it to a iffy tuna lover, you have to love tuna, which i do. I would give it a try.
It was simple and quick. I liked it.

this is the first time that I've ever followed a recipe for tuna salad, and I doubt if I ever will again. Tuna, mayo, good relish, yellow mustard, and some hard boiled eggs if you have time. It ain't rocket surgery.

I absolutely loved this recipe and I'm picky when it comes to tuna salad. I did half mayo and half dressing. The only thing I added was celery as I love the taste and crunch. I will make this again and again.

Was making tuna salad and decided to see if anyone had a new twist. I made it as directed and it was good but I always put celery and egg in mine. So I added chopped celery and it was very good now! I went ahead and added a hard boiled egg, it was good but not sure it added much to the flavor but the celery was an absolute keeper. My husband really enjoyed it and told me to keep this recipe. Thank you!

This is hands down the best tuna salad I've ever eaten! The flavor is robust and the spices complement the tuna perfectly.
The only thing I changed was that I had no curry (my wife doesn't like it) so I added just a teaspoon of yellow mustard instead. Either way it was delicious.
Normally I add diced celery and lemon juice to my tuna salads but with this recipe it wasn't needed.

Made a few changes simply because I didn't have some items. I used dried shallots. I added a bit of horseradish for a slight kick. I didn't have relish or garlic so I just omitted them. The curry is a great addition. Love the flavor. Hoping to have all the ingredients next time.

Jon
I Think it tastes good with the changes I made.
I give the recipe 4 stars

I liked the flavor boost with the curry and dill and parmesan but I added celery as I like crunch in my tuna salad. Also used less mayo. My 10 year old granddaughter said this made a delicious sandwich.
This is the BEST TUNA SALAD! My new favorite. Made it exactly as is, it doesn't need any tweaking! This is so much better than the soggy mayo version everyone makes. You must give it a try.
I omitted the curry powder as it's not a fave of my family's, but this recipe is amazing...so yummy!!
This was a nice change to regular tuna and my hubby who loves curry also loved this. Between the curry and the sweet pickle relish it was pretty sweet but a nice change.

I was looking for something different from the ordinary tuna salad that we typically eat and came upon this one. What a keeper! The ingredients don't seem like they would meld well but they do. My children and I love it! We even tried it with boiled eggs in the mix at the end. Like I said, thos one is a keeper.
Great! Did not use curry as I do not like it. Used low fat Miracle Whip.
This is delicious...so glad I tried it! This recipe is definitely a keeper. Thank you!
Very simple recipe. And tasty. I made it into tuna melts on a bagel.
This is the best tuna salad I've ever had!!! Very quick and easy to prepare, but absolutely delicious! The only adjustment I made was less mayo, but that's just a preference. Thank you!!!!
This is a good recipe. Of course, all these seasonings are to taste and I had to flavor it a bit more, but absolutely LOVE IT!! THANKS BARBIE
Excellent and easy to make, definitely, a keeper.

This is by far the best tuna salad I’ve ever tasted! Don’t second guess the quantities. Make it exactly as written and you won’t be disappointed! It’s now on my weekly lunch rotation! Thanks for sharing!!
I’m afraid this was not quite palatable for me. All I could taste was curry. I think I have determined that I prefer tuna more on the plain side. My husband said it was ok so we gave it 3 stars.

Correction to my previous review. Mistakenly gave one too many stars. There is too much going on in this recipe. I really wanted to like it but there are too many competing flavors and the strongest of them didn’t do much for me. I found the dill and parsley over powering and I normally love both herbs, just not in tuna salad apparently. I was excited about the Parmesan and grated it fresh but unfortunately it and the garlic powder were lost amidst the other flavors. I did like the subtle taste of curry in this though. I’m not sure how most people make “boring old tuna salad” but I’ve always made it with mayo, pickles and onions. Simple and delicious. In this recipe I missed the pickles. The sweet relish didn’t cut it for me. If I want a twist on tuna salad from now on I think I’ll just add a bit of curry to my normal recipe.

I rarely give 5 stars but this was close. I used a nice tuna called Wild Planet Albacore Wild Tuna. I used a total of 20 oz because I'm feeding my husband and 3 teenage boys. I guessed pretty much on all the quantity of the ingredients according to my/our tastes. I didn't want too much of a relish flavor so I poured the relish into a small strainer and squeezed it down to get as much liquid out of it as possible. I think that was a great idea. I also didn't add quite as much as relish as it called for. I couldn't BELIEVE I was out of dried parsley, so I added a little chopped green onion and mined celery that gave it a perfect crunch. Also a tiny bit of fresh cilantro because we all love it. My husband was SO adamant for me NOT to add the curry powder, but I did anyway and not too much. Ha, he liked it just as a thought. I also added red pepper flakes to kick it up. I'm going to put it on English Muffin Bread and melt cheese over the top for a tuna melt. And I will serve this with a homemade tomato soup and this will be our dinner. Yum.

This is really yummy!! I skipped the relish, and used fresh onions instead of the flakes, and it was just perfect!
we used Sourdough bread for sandwiches!

I didn't love this as it was written, but with some corrections, it came out good. The parmesan was a good addition, but the dill relish could have just been pickles added to the top. I could barely taste any garlic powder, and the tuna lacked any bright acidity. To improve it I added some pepper, and something with vinegar (mustard, salad dressing, apple cider vinegar, lemon juice). Mayo could be substituted for avocado, olive oil, pesto, hummus, or anything that is a healthy fat and can add some creaminess to the tuna. For crunch, shredded carrots, radishes, or even celery would work. For toppings, I would use pickles, lettuce, tomato, and fresh red onion, not minced onion.
